Description: Fragment of a tapestry applied and sewn to an undyed linen plain weave textile; a leaf-shaped tapestry with a beige Greek vase in the centre, from which green and yellow branches and leafs spring out; on each side of the vase is a green and yellow bird (with pink necklaces), the bodies are towards the edges but the heads look back towards the vase; background is red; balanced plain weave, visible at the reverse: warp-undyed linen (S/15), weft-undyed linen (S/15); 4 picks of grouped wefts; tapestry on grouped threads- warp-undyed linen (S spun Z ply/16), weft-undyed, yellow, light green, green, blue, dark blue, orange, pink, red wool (S/red is 72); sewing threads in undyed linen (S ply); edges are cut following the shape of the tapestry
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
